item.title: Great films to watch

item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:76, topic:382223”][quote author=zachera link=topic=478025.msg3544586#msg3544586 date=1301103354]
Book of Eli is a great film too, I never understood why it wasn’t a bigger success than it was.
[/quote]
Because it’s “slow” and people can’t appreciate those types of films[/quote]I just finished watching (and criticising) it and I will agree it is a bit long but also they did overrate religion just a tad bit, but that’s solely based on my opinion and beliefs (that being entirely neutral - not for or against religion, but believing that religion is useful for whom it is deemed useful for).

item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

So I spent a few hours today and yesterday watching these four movies:

  • The Chaperone
  • Kung Fu Panda
  • Big Mommas 3
  • 300

Gotta say that 300 was the best of the four. I’m probably going to watch Inception later or tomorrow.

item.title: Great films to watch
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

summary of stargate: sg-1 awesome until o’neill left but it was still pretty good after that, atlantis wasn’t nearly as good as sg-1 but worth watching and I stopped watching universe after the 6th episode

one thing I will say about atlantis is the last 2 episodes of the series was one of the better endings to any tv series I have seen

ps something to note: sg-1 has a ridiculously similar concept to star trek tos/tng, atlantis is similar to star trek ds9, universe is similar to voyager etc, and all the star trek versions are better !!

Read full topic

item.title: Great films to watch
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:61, topic:382223”][quote author=zuppers link=topic=478025.msg3530703#msg3530703 date=1300142619]
I actually like SGU the best. I’ve watched all of SG-1 and SGA.
[/quote]SGU was much too modernized to be good in my opinion. Too much drama, not enough Sci-Fi.[/quote]I sort of feel like the other series (besides SGA) didn’t have enough Sci-fi. I will admit SGU is a lot different from the other series and at first I was skeptical but it turns out it’s not as bad as I thought it was going to be.

Edit: SGA was like the perfect in-between lol

Read full topic

item.title: Great films to watch
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:55, topic:382223”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=478025.msg3529531#msg3529531 date=1300056672]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=478025.msg3529493#msg3529493 date=1300053658]

I also watched district 9 earlier today it was also very good.

I really like sci-fi shows, but that was one of the very worst movies I’ve ever seen!
[/quote]I actually found it to be one of they very few new sci-fi movies i enjoyed. I mean let’s face it, sci-fi hasn’t been at its prime since the 60’s/70’s.

Did you miss Star Trek: The Next Generation in the 90s?
[/quote]By “prime” i mean, in its absolutely best obviously. Star Trek TNG was great, but it was only one series. Nearly EVERYTHING sci-fi related in the late 60’s was fantastic.[/quote]

There have been a lot of very good ones in the 80s and 90s as well. Quantum Leap, Sliders, Star Trek TNG and Voyager, probably many others I’m forgetting about.

The only really good ones I know about earlier would be the original Star Trek, The Twilight Zone, The Outer Limits and such. They did remake the twilight zone and the outer limits in the 80s/90s as well, some of them were good.

Read full topic
